titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Ms. Codex 7: Disputations on the Physics, Metaphysics and De anima of Aristotle

availability.licence: These images and the content of Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts Ms. Codex 7: Disputations on the Physics, Metaphysics and De anima of Aristotle are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. notesStmt.note: Written on the recto of the front flyleaf: Pertinet ad Capistrani Locum.
A loose slip of paper containing a short, fragmentary text in Italian has been inserted. It appears to be contemporary with the text.

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Consists of 24 disputations on the Physics, 6 disputations on the Metaphysics and 6 disputations on the De anima. Each of the disputations is divided into several questions.

msItem.title: Disputations on the Physics, Metaphysics and De anima of Aristotle

supportDesc.extent: 260 leaves: 190 x 121 (150 x 102) mm. bound to 192 x 130 mm. +
supportDesc.foliation: Paper, i (contemporary paper) + 160 + i (contemporary paper); [1-260]; modern foliation in pencil, upper right recto.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in 31 long lines; ruled in drypoint.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in a cursive script by what appears to be a single hand.

binding.p: Contemporary limp vellum leaf from a music manuscript, most likely containing the notation for the religious motet, Tribus miraculis.

origin.p: Written in Italy in the second half of the 16th century.
